title: Erin Molan 'falls ill' and misses huge win at the Australian Commercial Radio Awards
text:
Erin Molan is 'gutted' she was forced to miss her win at the Australian Commercial Radio Awards in Brisbane on Saturday night after 'falling ill'.

The 37-year-old's show 2GB Afternoons With Erin Molan And Natalie Peters won Best On Air Team at the ceremony, but Natalie was forced to accept it alone.

'Erin is devastated she can't be here in Brisbane. We are really honoured to have this show,' said Natalie on stage, according to The Daily Telegraph.

Sad! Erin Molan is 'gutted' she was forced to miss her win at the Australian Commercial Radio Awards in Brisbane on Saturday night after 'falling ill'. Pictured: Erin at Dally M Awards in 2016

Taking to Instagram on Sunday, Erin said: 'Such an honour to just be a finalist - we honestly thought we were no chance of winning ... couldn't be more proud!

'This one means a bloody lot! Gutted I was out of action.'

Co-host Natalia said on Instagram: 'I wish Erin could have been by my side - she really is the most talented, hard-working, hilarious co-host a gal could wish for.

'Turns out we're the first all-female team to ever win this award, which is an incredible honour.'

Solo! The 37-year-old's show 2GB Afternoons With Erin Molan And Natalie Peters (pictured) won Best On Air Team at the ceremony, but Natalie was forced to accept it alone

'Erin is devastated she can't be here in Brisbane. We are really honoured to have this show,' said Natalie (left) on stage, according to The Daily Telegraph, as Erin was 'ill'

Erin's no-show at the ceremony comes after she has missed a list of high-profile events lately, following her rumoured 'feud' with Andrew Johns.

Speaking on 2GB's The Steven Price Show on October 2, Erin admitted she had just finished self-tanning ahead of the Dally M Awards that evening in Sydney.

However, the sports reporter was a no-show when the red carpet began hours later and did not attend.

Honoured! Taking to Instagram on Sunday, Erin said, 'Such an honour to just be a finalist - we honestly thought we were no chance of winning ... couldn't be more proud!'

Low profile! Erin's no-show at the ceremony comes after she has missed a list of high-profile events lately, following her rumoured 'feud' with Andrew Johns

Erin did not appear at Nine's Upfronts 2020 event in Sydney on Wednesday night either, with the majority of the network's other talent attending.

According to The Daily Telegraph, she was 'forced to miss' her radio show over the weekend too, with the paper claiming she had 'fallen ill'.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Erin's rep for comment.
description: Erin Molan is 'gutted' she was forced to miss her win at the Australian Commercial Radio Awards in Brisbane on Saturday night after 'falling ill'.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
